noun.description: The quality of being worthy of attention; importance.
examples: adolescent education was felt to be a social issue of some significance

noun.description: The meaning to be found in words or events.
examples: the significance of what was happening was clearer to me than to her

noun.description: The extent to which a result deviates from that expected to arise simply from random variation or errors in sampling.

origin: Late Middle English (denoting unstated meaning): from Old French, or from Latin significantia, from significare indicate, portend.
